ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through this course I learned valuable history and cultural knowledge, recontextualizing a lot of the history I had learned before. I learned about the relationship between Europe and the Americas, and about past and current bordering practices.

Taking this course helped me strengthen my Spanish skills, but the content of the course helped expand my knowledge of the creation of borders in the world. This was by far one of my favorite courses because of the amount of internal learning that I was able to do.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very engaging and interesting- I don't have any outstanding weaknesses I can identify.
The strengths of this course were the discussions that were built into the learning method. By reading, then discussing what was read, I was able to further my own understanding of the readings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would! It is very engaging and I learned a lot of very important history. The readings were great and the assignments were never too stressful or confusing.
